ygData.msgSnippet: Tavatron watched Hakibuscon carefully, a slight snarl escaping her lips. This bot was trying her patience. First he had fired on them, then he had acted as if

From: "FIRE FOX" <firefox_y2k@...>

Tavatron watched Hakibuscon carefully, a slight snarl escaping her lips. 
This 'bot was trying her patience. First he had fired on them, then he had 
acted as if nothing had happened at all! It was 'bot s like this that 
confused her most. He was most likely neutral, since Predacons didn't act in 
such a foolish manner, well, most of them anyway, and she didn't recognize 
him as a Maximal. Tavatron almost sighed with relief when Hakibuscon stated 
that he was leaving, with no intent of harming them. She knew Dinobot would 
never admit it, but he was in no condition for battle. She had felt him limp 
slightly as they walked toward the water, not to mention what that missle 
had done to his shoulder plate.

Tavatron shook her head solemnly as Hakibuscon threw his weapons in the 
water. A waste of perfectly good battle tech, not to mention a rather 
impressive laser sword. Tavatron found herself thinking back to when she had 
last used her staff. She had to find it, it was her primary weapon, not to 
mention her favorite. It was the first weapon she had learned to use. Though 
most hand to hand combat weapons were outdated and useless nowadays, she 
still preferred it to any blaster or splatter gun, no matter how advanced it 
was. Each weapon had certain feel to it. The weapon, in essence, becomes a 
part of you, an extension so to speak. Why this 'bot would throw away up a 
part of himself just confused her even further.

Tavatron watched as Hakibuscon dissapeared, quickly scanning the area so as 
not to be caught off guard in case this was some sort of trick. 'Bots didn't 
just dissapear like that, did they? This 'bot's business was his own, and 
she wasn't going to concern herself with it any longer. Tavatron waited 
patiently as Dinobot pulled each seperate weapon from the cool brook, 
tossing them aside. They were useless now, a pity:

"I have no idea."

Tavatron raised her nose to the sky as she let out a long, plantive howl. 
Night was closing and the moon was full, the perfect atmosphere for a 
creature such as herself. Wolves thrived during the twilight hours, as did 
she. She couldn't help it. With each emergence of a new star Tavatron's howl 
grew in volume and intensity until it was joined by several other wolves. 
She finally stopped howling, but only because there was no real quarry in 
the surrounding woods, or so the other wolves had told her. [Quick fact: 
When you hear a wolf howl it's actually talking to other wolves, i.e. 
packmates. Wolves don't howl for fun, they howl in order to communicate over 
long distances ^_^]

Tavatron's gaze then turned to Dinobot, the smile on her face fading as she 
watched him walk toward a rise in the clearing. His limp had become 
noticibly heavier, not to mention fluid had begun to trickle down his 
injured side again. She almost didn't hear him speak as she watched him lay 
down and begin to tend his wounds. Finally Tavatron responded:

"Yes, of course."

Tavatron growled in annoyance as mech fluid began to gush from his injured 
side. Enough was enough! Why didn't he say he was this injured? She would 
rather have walked than ride and risk further injury! Tavatron's anger then 
became concern as she realized he was just going to let the wound bleed out, 
something that could result in a severe loss of fluid. Tavatron sighed 
softly as she got to her feet and walked over to Dinobot, kneeling beside 
him in the mech stained grass. Her tone was soft and non-threatening:

"Want me to try and bandage that for you?"
